intro: Psilocaulon marlothii, commonly known as the Marloth's ghost flower, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of South Africa, particularly in the Western Cape Province. The plant is characterized by its unique, umbrella-like inflorescence composed of numerous small, pale blue or white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Psilocaulon marlothii is considered a vulnerable species.
